Headline: #60 Blue Island/26th Temporary Reroute at Blue Island/Wolcott
ShortDescription: 60 Blue Island/26th buses are temporarily rerouted via Blue Island, Damen, Cermak and Ashland: due to, a festival near Blue Island/Wolcott.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
#60 Blue Island/26th buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions via Blue Island, Damen, Cermak, Ashland and over regular route, due to a festival near Blue Island/Wolcott.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: #75 74th-75th Temporary Westbound Reroute near 74th/Racine
ShortDescription: Westbound 75 74th-75th buses are temporarily rerouted via 76th, Ashland and 74th: due to, street blockage near 74th/Racine.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Westbound #75 74th-75th buses are temporarily rerouted via 76th, Ashland and 74th: due to, street blockage near 74th/Racine.

Eastbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Bus Substitution Between Illinois Medical District and UIC-Halsted
ShortDescription: Shuttle buses replace Blue Line service between Illinois Medical District and UIC-Halsted.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Shuttle buses replace rail service between Illinois Medical District and UIC-Halsted.

Trains will run between O’Hare and UIC-Halsted, and between Forest Park and Illinois Medical District.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
We are performing construction at the Racine Blue Line station and Morgan substation.

MAP

Headline: Howard-bound Red Line Service Delayed at Chicago
ShortDescription: Howard-bound Red Line trains are standing at Chicago due to a track condition. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Howard-bound Red Line trains are standing at Chicago due to a track condition.

Consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes or using buses to other rail lines.

These may include:

#22 Clark

#36 Broadway

#66 Chicago

Shuttle buses are available to provide connecting service between Fullerton to Lake in both directions.

restore service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Howard-bound Subway Trains Rerouted to Elevated Tracks
ShortDescription: Howard-bound Red Line subway trains are temporarily rerouted to the elevated tracks between Cermak and Fullerton due to track conditions.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Howard-bound Red Line subway trains are temporarily rerouted to the elevated lines between Cermak-Chinatown and Fullerton due to track conditions.

Train service to Howard

After stopping at Cermak-Chinatown, Howard-bound trains will be diverted and will make the following elevated station stops:

  • Roosevelt (elevated station west of Wabash; accessible)
  • Adams/Wabash
  • Washington/Wabash (accessible)
  • State/Lake
  • Clark/lake (accessible)
  • Merchandise Mart (accessible)
  • Chicago (at Franklin; accessible)
  • Sedgwick (accessible)
  • Armitage (accessible)

Then, trains will stop at Fullerton and make all normal stops to Howard.

Connections can be made between 95th/Dan Ryan-bound subway service and Howard-bound rerouted service via elevated lines at State/Lake (transfer to nearby elevated station, board on Brown Line side) and at Roosevelt (accessible).

We apologize for the inconvenience and are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

95th/Dan Ryan-bound service is not affected.
